channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023081579
item.description:
Report X-2023081579

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found on the dock with wet outer packaging. package was then placed in a salvage drum DescribePack: upon investigation, one of the bottles inside of the package had a loose cap, causing internal leakage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside of a hazardous waste bag, and then into a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2023081576

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Jerrican was found with wet outter, and was noticed to have been leaking from closure lid. DescribePack: Jerrican lid seemed to have not been all the way sealed, causing leakage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Jerrican was placed into plastic hazardous waste bag, and then into a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2023081275
item.description:
Report X-2023081275

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: One of our unload managers brought over the hazmat I asked him what happened and he replied the hazmat began to become wet once they were placing it on the belt to go to the unloads. DescribePack: The box was wet on one side and the box looked like it was about to begin falling apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moment i noticed the release starting I immediately placed the hazmat in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081108
item.description:
Report X-2023081108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG ARRIVED AT QA AND WAS WET ON ONE SIDE. IT WAS ALSO ON IT SIDE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS POINTING THE WRONG WAY. PKG WAS PLACED UPRIGHT AND OPENED AND INSPECTED. CAPS ON 1 OF THE 3 JUGS WAS LOOSE. ONCE IT WAS TIGHTENED, PKG WAS SECURED AND INSPECTED FURTHER. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP, NO HOLES IN ANY OF THE JUGS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED UPRIGHT AND CAPS WERE TIGHTENTED. ENTIRE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND SECURED.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped off from unloads by one of our managers, box was wet. DescribePack: The package was very wet when I opened it up I saw where the bottle inside was cracked and broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately when I noticed the leaking hazmat I placed it inside of a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081520
item.description:
Report X-2023081520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA CAGE BY BELT MANAGER, WHO DISCOVERED THAT PKG WAS WET/LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM OF PKG. UPON INSPECTION, WE NOTICED PIECES OF FOREIGN GLASS IN THE BOX, WHICH PUNTURED 1 OF 4 BOTTLES AND LEAKED ON ALL 4 BOTTLES CONTAIMING ENTIRE PKG. DescribePack: 1/8 IN CUT/PUNTURE IN 1 BOTTLE (IN BODY) DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA TEAM ISOLATED PKG IN LINED HAZMAT TOTE. WE THEN MOVED THE TOTE INTO HAZMAT CAGE UNDERNEATH THE AIR VENT.
